"S." The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include a spending limitation for fiscal year 2006 and beyond. A point of order is established to ensure that budget resolutions are consistent with the spending limitation. Waiving or suspending this point of order requires a two-thirds majority vote in the House of Representatives or the Senate. REDUCTION OF FICA RATES RESULTING FROM PERSONAL SOCIAL SECURITY SAVINGS PROGRAM. Employee Contribution: Section 3101 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to reduce the tax rate on employees for Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance in certain years following a reduction year. The reduction percentage is based on the rate in effect under subsection (a). The reduction percentage under the Social Security Personal Savings Guarantee and Prosperity Act of 2004 is calculated based on the difference between the rate in effect for the reduction year and the rate that would result in a 125 percent OASDI rate ratio. The OASDI rate ratio is the ratio of the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust. The OASDI rate ratio is defined as the ratio of the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund to the amount paid from these Trust Funds for authorized purposes in a calendar year.
